nl.tue.fingerpaint.client.gui.animation

Class SizeAnimation

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.gwt.animation.client.Animation
      • nl.tue.fingerpaint.client.gui.animation.SizeAnimation

  • public class SizeAnimation
extends com.google.gwt.animation.client.Animation
    A SizeAnimation can animate the size of an element.
    Author:
    Group Fingerpaint

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int ANIMATE_BOTH
      Constant to indicate that both sides (height and width) should be animated on hide/show.
      static int ANIMATE_HEIGHT
      Constant to indicate that only the height should be animated.
      static int ANIMATE_WIDTH
      Constant to indicate that only the width should be animated.
      private int axis
      Axis to animate
      private int elOrigHeight
      Original height of the element.
      private int elOrigWidth
      Original width of the element.
      private boolean hidden
      If element is hidden or not.
      private com.google.gwt.user.client.rpc.AsyncCallback<Boolean> onCompleteCallback
      Callback on finish of animation.
      private boolean running
      If animation is in progress.
      private com.google.gwt.dom.client.Element subject
      Panel that is animated.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SizeAnimation

        public SizeAnimation(com.google.gwt.dom.client.Element animationSubject,
             int animationAxis)
        Construct a new object that can be used to animate the given element.
        Parameters:
        animationSubject - The element to be animated.
        animationAxis - Which axis to animate. Use ANIMATE_BOTH, ANIMATE_HEIGHT or ANIMATE_WIDTH here.

    • Method Detail

      • refreshSize

        public void refreshSize()
        Internally update the size of the element that is animated.

      • setAxis

        public void setAxis(int axis)
        Change which axis are animated. Use ANIMATE_BOTH, ANIMATE_HEIGHT or ANIMATE_WIDTH here. When not one of these constants, ANIMATE_WIDTH is used.
        Parameters:
        axis - The new axis.

      • doShow

        public void doShow(int durationMillis)
        Perform a sliding animation to show the element, that is, restore its position before a call to doHide(int). If the element is not hidden by such a call, nothing happens.
        Parameters:
        durationMillis - Time the animation takes.

      • doShow

        public void doShow(int durationMillis,
          com.google.gwt.user.client.rpc.AsyncCallback<Boolean> onComplete)
        Perform a sliding animation to show the element, that is, restore its position before a call to doHide(int). If the element is not hidden by such a call, nothing happens.
        Parameters:
        durationMillis - Time the animation takes.
        onComplete - Callback to call when animation is done. Ignored when null. This callback will (guaranteed) only be called with a true argument on the AsyncCallback#onSuccess(Object) callback.

      • doHide

        public void doHide(int durationMillis)
        Perform a sliding animation to hide the element on the selected side of the screen.
        Parameters:
        durationMillis - Time the animation takes.

      • doHide

        public void doHide(int durationMillis,
          com.google.gwt.user.client.rpc.AsyncCallback<Boolean> onComplete)
        Perform a sliding animation to hide the element on the selected side of the screen.
        Parameters:
        durationMillis - Time the animation takes.
        onComplete - Callback to call when animation is done. Ignored when null. This callback will (guaranteed) only be called with a true argument on the AsyncCallback#onSuccess(Object) callback.

      • getInternalHeight

        public int getInternalHeight()
        Return the height of the element as is saved in this animation.
        Returns:
        the (original) height of the element as internally saved

      • getInternalWidth

        public int getInternalWidth()
        Return the width of the element as is saved in this animation.
        Returns:
        the (original) width of the element as internally saved
